name: qsv-geoconvert
description: Convert between various spatial formats and CSV/SVG including GeoJSON, SHP, and more.

args.name: input
args.description: The spatial file to convert. To use stdin instead, use a dash "-". Note: SHP input must be a path to a .shp file and cannot use stdin.

options.description: The name of the column that has WKT geometry. Alternative to --latitude and --longitude.
The name of the column with northing values.
The name of the column with easting values.

The maximum column length when the output format is CSV. Oftentimes, the geometry column is too long to fit in a CSV file, causing other tools like Python & PostgreSQL to fail. If a column is too long, it will be truncated to the specified length and an ellipsis ("...") will be appended.
Write output to <file> instead of stdout.
